intro: Chadsia lantziana, commonly known as the Lantz's chadsia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. Chadsia lantziana is often found in rocky areas and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
